bug.short_desc: in oocalc mouse click that grabs focus and selects a cell selects a lower cell(s) also
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Since upgrading from F23 to F24, oocalc now shows a strange new behaviour. If I am in another (non-LOo) window and then click on a cell in a oocalc window, not only will oocalc get focus (correct), and select the cell I clicked on (correct), it will also highlight 1 or 2 cells below the one I clicked on, just like if I had clicked and dragged from the initial cell to the one below.
Even if I am extremely careful to not move the mouse while clicking, it still selects 2-3 cells instead of just the 1.
Note, the cell I do indeed wants remains the "active" cell, so in that sense it's not too bad as I can just start typing as I normally would.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): libreoffice-calc-5.1.6.2-5.fc24.x86_64 gtk3-3.20.9-1.fc24.x86_64 gtk2-2.24.31-1.fc24.x86_64 sawfish-1.12.0-1.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. open oocalc window and start a new sheet 2. open any other window, like a gnometerm 3. click to focus the gnometerm 4. click on a cell in the middle of the oocalc sheet
Actual results: oocalc highlights a cell and the 1 or 2 below it also
Expected results: oocalc highlights/selects just the 1 cell I clicked on
Additional info: I use sawfish wm and xfce. I use click to focus mouse policy.

Does this problem still persist. There were some location event problems wrt the first event received appearing not at the expected location and some fake events inserted in to smooth out the difference, so this may have been one of those problems

Yes, bug persist as of: libreoffice-core-5.1.6.2-8.fc24.x86_64
I have no F25 to test with yet, though it's very easy to reproduce, unless it's also dependent on wm (mine is sawfish).
I feel this was the same problem that I fixed with https://cgit.freedesktop.org/libreoffice/core/commit/?id=dfe7142cdd057 so should be good in 5.2, definitely don't see it in F25 myself anymore
